result.execSummary:
The defendant Andre J Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample. DNA surcharge Imposed and due by 9/6/2018, failure to pay will result in civil judgment/tax intercept
Court ordered court cost, fees and surcharges waived due to indigency
Defendant to serve 45 days in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence to with credit for 33 days time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andre J Smith

records.addlTxt: Received and filed.

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense counsel and Defendant.

COURT ORDERED 

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant to serve 45 days in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence to with credit for 33 days time served. 

Provide a DNA sample. DNA surcharge Imposed and due by 9/6/2018, failure to pay will result in civil judgment/tax intercept
Court ordered court cost, fees and surcharges waived due to indigency 
Appellate rights notice given to the defendant.

Documents received and filed:
Notice of Right to seek post conviction relief
Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Andre J Smith in court with attorney Prashant Dayal.  Defendant Andre J Smith in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KKO  
Case in court for Plea Hearing/Sentencing hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

Plea hearing held

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Documents received and filed.
Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum and Jury Instructions
Court ordered ALL previous conditions of bail to remain the same.
Bail motion by defense argued and GRANTED by the Court. State has no objection.

Attorney Prashant Dayal in court, defendant Andre J Smith not in court, in custody and not produced.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Defendant's appearance waived for today's proceedings.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 6, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Prashant Dayal in court, defendant Andre J Smith not in court, in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KKO  
Case in court for Status Conference. Defense requests a pretrial conference for reasons placed on the record. State does not object. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 45.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 8, 2018 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Signature bond ordered reinstated in the amount of 750.00. Court further ordered all previous/terms conditions of bail reinstated.

Defendant Andre J Smith not in court, in custody. Lara Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is recalled on the record from the AM session. Court was informed that the defendant was recently arrested and is in custody, not produced for today's proceedings. Court orders previously issued bench warrant WITHDRAWN and permanently STAYED. Bail to be reinstated as previously set. Matter set for status. Status Conference scheduled for January 5, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 750.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Prashant Dayal in court.  Lara Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for Scheduling Conference.  Defendant failing to appear. State request a bench warrant. Upon the request of the State, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued and forfeit of bail.
received and filed.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Andre J Smith in court with attorney Christian Thomas.  Defendant Andre J Smith in custody.  Andrea L Fendry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 3, 2018 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: NO REPLY FROM SURETY/DEFENDANT.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($500.00) ad
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Eric M. Vega in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.

Defendant Andre J Smith in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Pre-trial conference held off the record. Defense counsel has received discovery and offer, additional time to review. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Andre J Smith in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Defendant Andre J Smith in custody.  William Patrick Pipp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
